DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Concomitant Performed Intervention or Procedure Sequence Identifier Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A number assigned to an activity (medication/measures/procedures) that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population that is following as a consequence.  This number is used to establish a serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a receurrent pattern.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Clinical Study Therapeutic Procedure Sequence Identifier Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A number used to establish sequence or a serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent plan for an action or administration of therapeutic agent which is administered within the context of a research study.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Adverse Event Therapeutic Procedure Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A Yes/No response to indicate whether an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process, has occurred in response to any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, syndrom, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Performed Reason Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A free text field that expains the cause of an activity, executed and carried through to completion, that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Eligibility Checklist Criteria Sequence Identifier Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A number or string of numbers used to identify the sequence of criteria that comprise the eligibilty checklist for enrollment into a clinical trial.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tumor Monoclonal Antibody SPARC Gene Expression Present Result
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Presence of SPARC expression in a tumor measured using a monoclonal antibody to SPARC.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Stroma Monoclonal Antibody SPARC Gene Expression Present Result
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Presence of SPARC expression within the stroma measured using a monoclonal antibody to SPARC.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tumor Polyclonal Antibody SPARC Gene Expression Present Result
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Presence of SPARC expression in a tumor measured using a polyclonal antibody to SPARC.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Stroma Polyclonal Antibody SPARC Gene Expression Present Result
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Presence of SPARC expression in the stroma measured using a polyclonal antibody to SPARC.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Nuclear Immunoreactivity Testing Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value representing extent of nuclear immunoreactivity.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: SPARC Gene Methylation Occurrence Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether the SPARC has/had a methyl group to the molecule.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Self-Report Invasive Cardiovascular Procedure Occurrence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether invasive/surgical cardiovascular procedures have occurred, excluding surgery for varicose veins.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Hypercholesterolemia Lipid Condition Occurrence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no subjective repsponse provided by the patient regarding the occurrence of the presence of a condition involving elevated levels of cholesterol or lipid problems.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Pacemaker Implantable Cardioverter-Defibrillator Placement Performed Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether the patient has had a procedure performed involving an incision and placement of electronic device that delivers electrical stimulation to the heart to treat bradycardia or a small, battery-powered device placed into the chest wall to detect arrhythmias and correct them by delivering a jolt of electricity.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Adrenal Gland Pheochromocytoma Occurrence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no subjective response regarding whether a patient has a benign or malignant neuroendocrine neoplasm of the sympathetic nervous system that secretes catecholamines arising from the chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Sleep Apnea Personal Medical History Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary experiences cessation of breathing for short periods during sleep (classified as obstructive, central, or mixed obstructive-central).  This information is part of the patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Family Medical History Heart Failure Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether the chronological record of health and disease events of a person's family members and ancestors includes the inability of the heart to pump blood at an adequate rate to meet tissue metabolic requirements or the ability to do so only at an elevated filling pressure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Positive Air Pressure Device Night Time Use Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a patient uses a device for the delivery of forced air through a mask worn during sleeping hours as a treatment for snoring and sleep apnea.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Family Medical History Cardiomyopathy Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether the chronological record of health and disease events of a person's family members and ancestors include a disease of the heart muscle or myocardium proper.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Family Medical History Cardiac Death Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the chronological record of health and disease events of a person's family members and ancestors includes sudden cessation of life due to heart issues.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Family Medical History Cardiac Pacemaker Requirement Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)__An electronic device that is implanted in the body to monitor heart rate and rhythm. It gives the heart electrical stimulation when it does not beat normally. It runs on batteries and has long, thin wires that connect it to the heart._Requirement; something that is necessary._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Illicit Substance Cessation Duration Year Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The number of years discontinuation of the habit using substances (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction has occurred.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Greater Than Integer::1 Alcohol Serving Per Day Occurrence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a person consumes more than 1 serving of alcohol per day.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Greater Than Integer::1 Daily Alcohol Serving Weekly Occurrence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a person has consumed more than 1 serving of alcohol per day for more than a period of a week or longer.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Family Medical History Cardiac Event Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text describing the cardiac health and disease events of a person's family members and ancestors.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Carvedilol Administered Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a patient has taken/received Carvedilol, a synthetic antihypertensive methoxyphenoxy- 2-propanol derivative with no intrinsic sympathomimetic activity, Carvedilol acts as a nonselective beta-adrenoceptor blocking agent (S(-) enantiomer) and as an alpha 1-adrenoceptor blocker (R(+) and S(-) enantiomers). Its acts more strongly on beta-receptors than on alpha 1-receptors, reduces peripheral vascular resistance by vasodilation, and prevents reflex tachycardia (beta-blockade) so that heart rate is either unchanged or decreased. Carvedilol also reduces renin release through beta-blockade. (NCI04)

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Ramipril Administered Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a patient has taken/received Ramipril, a prodrug and nonsulfhydryl angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor with antihypertensive activity. Ramipril is converted in the liver by de-esterification into its active form ramiprilat, which inhibits ACE, thereby blocking the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II. This abolishes the potent vasoconstrictive actions of angiotensin II and leads to vasodilatation. This agent also causes an increase in bradykinin levels and a decrease in angiotensin II-induced aldosterone secretion by the adrenal cortex, thereby promoting diuresis and natriuresis.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dyspnea Paroxysmal Nocturnal Adverse Event Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response regarding whether the patient is experiencing a disorder characterized by episodes of respiratory distress, usually occurring after several hours of sleep in a reclining position. It is most commonly caused by pulmonary edema resulting from congestive heart failure. The episodes may be accompanied by coughing, a feeling of suffocation, a cold sweat, and tachycardia.  These symptoms are events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dyspnea Supine Position Adverse Event Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response regarding whether the patient is experiencing difficult, painful breathing or shortness of breath while in a posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward.  These symptoms are events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Night Time Cough Adverse Event Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response regarding whether the patient is experiencing a sudden, often repetitive, spasmodic contraction of the thoracic cavity, resulting in violent release of air from the lungs, and usually accompanied by a distinctive sound during the night.  These symptoms are events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dyspnea With Physical Activity Adverse Event Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response regarding whether the patient is experiencing difficult, painful breathing or shortness of breath with any any form of exercise or movement that can be described as exertion.  These symptoms are events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dyspnea With Normal Physical Activity Adverse Event Present  Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response regarding whether the patient is experiencing difficult, painful breathing or shortness of breath with any any form of exercise or movement that can be described as ordinary exertion, such as climbin up one flight of stairs without stopping.  These symptoms are events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dyspnea  With Household Activity Adverse Event Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response regarding whether the patient is experiencing difficult, painful breathing or shortness of breath with physical activities which are required for our daily existence such as walking around your home and activities of daily living.  These symptoms are events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Dyspnea At Rest Adverse Event Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response regarding whether the patient is experiencing difficult, painful breathing or shortness of breath while being still or inactive characterized by episodes of repiratory distress, usually occurring after several hours of sleep in a reclining position.  It is most commony caused by pulmonary edema resulting from congestive heart failure.  These symptoms are events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Jugular Vein Distention Present  Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether veins in the neck which drain the brain, face, and neck into the brachiocephalic or subclavian veins are stretched out or inflated.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Estimate Jugular Vein Pressure Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The numerical response of an estimated force applied to a unit area of surface in the neck veins that drain the brain, face, and neck into the brachiocephalic or subclavian veins.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pulmonary Edema Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the existence of an accumulation of fluid in the lung tissues causing disturbance of the gas exchange that may lead to respiratory failure. It is caused by direct injury to the lung parenchyma or congestive heart failure. The symptoms may appear suddenly or gradually. Suddenly appearing symptoms include difficulty breathing, feeling of suffocation, and coughing associated with frothy sputum. Gradually appearing symptoms include difficulty breathing while lying in bed, shortness of breath during activity, and weight gain (in patients with congestive heart failure).

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Foot Ankle Edema Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The numerical value representing the extent of accumulation of excessive amount of watery fluid in cells or intercellular tissues of the lower extremity, especially the ankle and parts below.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Chest X-ray Assessment Order Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A response regarding whether a chest x-ray procedure has been requested.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Electrocardiography Diagnostic Procedure Order Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A response regarding whether an electrocardiography (procedure which records the electrical current in the heart in the form of a continuous strip graph) procedure has been requested.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Brain Natriuretic Peptide Measurement Assessment Order Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A response regarding whether a procedure to determine the amount of brain natriuretic peptide present has been requested.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Blood Test Laboratory Procedure Order Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A response regarding whether a comprehensive blood test has been requested.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Chest X-ray Assessment Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The free text response regarding information related to the assessment of a chest X-ray.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Brain Natriuretic Peptide Measurement Assessment Lab Result Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The free text response regarding the determination of the amount of brain natriuretic peptide present in a sample.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Blood Test Lab Result Specify
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The free text response regarding the information obtained related to a blood test.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Baseline Brain Natriuretic Peptide Measurement Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The numerical response to quantify the amount of brain natriuretic peptide present in a sample that was collected at baseline.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Heart Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction  2-Dimensional Echocardiogram Assessment Lab Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The percentage value of the baseline measurement of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction using an image of the heart produced by ultrasonography that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Electrocardiogram Finding Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The condition/status of heart function based upon the summary finding of an electrocardiogram

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Stress Echocardiogram Ischemia Evidence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether the results of a stress echocardiogram (ultrasonography) of the heart suggest or show signs of blood deficiency caused by a constriction or obstruction of blood vessels.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Stress Echocardiogram Heart Wall Motion Abnormality Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the presence of unusual physical characteristics of the movement (change in position) of the layer of tissue that encloses the heart observed during a stress echocardiogram.  This unusual characteristic may be suggestive of ischemia.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Additional Testing Required Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a patient who is receiving medical attention, care or treatment needs to have further laboratory testing performed.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Ischemia And/Or Cardiomyopathy Etiology Disease or Disorder Involvement Suspected Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a blood deficiency in an organ or tissue caused by a constriction or obstruction of its blood vessels OR a cause of a disease of the heart muscle are possible diagnoses.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Six Minute Walk Run Test Baseline Oxygen Saturation Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Oxygen saturation percentage as a baseline measure for a six minute walk run test.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Six Minute Walk Run Test Recovery Oxygen Saturation Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Oxygen saturation percentage measured at recovery from a six minute walk run test.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: LDL Cholesterol Goals LDL Lab Result Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The corrected standard against which the measurement of the lipoprotein that carries cholesterol around the body is compared._The end-result or objective, which may be specified or required in advance._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Patient Low Density Lipoprotein Criterion Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a patient's low-density lipoprotein level has met a study established criterion.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Antihypertensive Agent Contraindicated Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether administering drugs used in the treatment of acute or chronic hypertension regardless of pharmacological mechanism is inadvisable.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Hepatojugular Reflux Present  Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether there is an elevation of venous pressure visible in the jugular veins and measurable in the veins of the arm, produced in active or impending congestive heart failure and constrictive pericarditis by firm pressure with the flat hand over the abdomen. Often called hepatojugular reflux when pressure is exclusively over the liver.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Pillow Use Pillow Count
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A cushion or support for the head or other body part; usually consisting of a cloth case surrounding a filler of feathers, down, plastic fibers, latex, rubber, or other foam material._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._A cushion or support for the head or other body part; usually consisting of a cloth case surrounding a filler of feathers, down, plastic fibers, latex, rubber, or other foam material._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Contrast Agent  Enhancement DetailsText
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text terms used to capture the names and doses of contrast/bolus agents given to increase visualization of structures and tissues during medical imaging.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Heart Echocardiogram Test Final Stress Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The response to the outcome of a final stress echocardiogram.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Angina Therapy Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether an action or therapeutic agent has been administered to a patient for a heart condition marked by paroxysms of chest pain due to reduced oxygen to the heart.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Angina Therapy Administered Specify Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text used to describe the list of angina therapy medications.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Metabolic Equivalent Assessment Metabolic Equivalent of Task Rate
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Having to do with metabolism._A person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc; being essentially equal to something._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI).  A unit of measurement of heat production by the body.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Slope Measurement Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The numerical quantity determined of a surface that departs from the horizontal measure in percentage.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Time Duration Second Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: A continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues._A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Movement Speed Measurement Rate
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Value to express the rate of movement of an individual expressed as the distance travelled divided by the time taken (average speed) or the rate of change of position with respect to time.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: SAFE-HEaRT. LCC. ghd. 08.12.13. v2.0 replaces v1.0 with increased overall field length and decimals. 1.15.2016.dmr

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Total Exercise Time Duration Second Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The total numerical quantity of time measured of an activity that requires physical or mental exertion in seconds.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Exercise Tolerance Test  End Reason
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Reasons that an exercise tolerance test was terminated.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: EKG ST Segment Depression Assessment Outcome Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The final determination of the result of the normal ST segment of the EKG tracing beginning at the isoelectric line and extending from the end of the S wave and curving gradually upward to the beginning of the T wave.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Baseline To EKG ST Segment Depression Duration Duration Second Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The length of time measured in seconds from the beginning of an EKG to the onset of ST segment depression.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Onset To RESOLVED EKG ST Segment Depression Duration Second Number
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The length of time measured in seconds from the onset to resolution of ST segment depression of an EKG.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Atrial Arrhythmia During Exercise Present Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the presence of irregular heart beats resulting from a pathologic process in the cardia atria during exercise.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor Fulfill Low Density Lipoprotein Criterion Requirement Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the requirement for administration of or increase in dosage of statins to meet low density lipoprotein (LDL) protocol goals.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Target Pulse Rate Pulse Measurement
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The calculated heart rate for a person based on age. (manually curated)

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Stress Exercise Laboratory Procedure Administered Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The particular method administered during a treadmill (cardiac) stress test.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Heart LVEF StressTest Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The descriptive results and/or status of the LVEF after administration of a treadmill stress test.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Carotid Artery Disorder Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the carotid artery._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Neoadjuvant Endocrine Therapy Plan Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The first planned endocrine/hormonal therapy regimen administered prior to any main treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Prior Therapy Off Treatment Reason
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The response or explanation as to why prior therapy was discontinued.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Expected Therapy Duration Expected Duration Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Expected; considered likely or probable._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._The period of time during which something continues._Expected; considered likely or probable._The period of time during which something continues._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Cardiac Outcome Documented Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The documented explanation of cardiac events that occurred during treatment.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Illicit Substance Specify Specify Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction._Be specific about something; define clearly._Be specific about something; define clearly._Text; the words of something written.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Stress Echocardiogram Ischemia Evidence Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The indication of regarding whether a stress echocardiogram shows evidence of blood deficiency in an organ or tissue caused by a constriction or obstruction of its blood vessels.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Treatment Regimen Intent Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The purpose of the treatment regimen or type of treatment given to a patient.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Exercise Tolerance Test End Other Specify Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The free text response that describes another reason why the exercise tolerance test was terminated.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Heart LVEF StressTest Lab Percentage Value
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The percentage value of the left ventricle ejection fraction as measured during an exercise stress test.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Fluid or Substance Biopsy Specimen Condition Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The identifiable class specimen material obtained from a biopsy referring to age/condition of specimen.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Lab Condition Specimen Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether the lab specimen is adequate in condition or volume for testing purposes.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Meaning Status Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the meaningfulness of an outcome of a laboratory test.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Heart Echocardiogram Test Initial Stress ECHO Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The status of the stress echocardiogram performed initially.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme 2 Agent Contraindicated Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether administering angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 inadvisable.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Released Guidelines Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based guidelines issued on test usage.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Food and Drug Administration Report Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on Food and Drug Administration (FDA) alerts issued about the availability of testing.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Sensitivity Diagnostic Specificity Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on test sensitivity and specificity to detect genetic change.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Genetic Variation Prevalence Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on the prevalence of the genetic variation.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Clinical Benefits Prediction Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on prediction of clinical benefits from specific treatments.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Toxicity Prediction Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on toxicity prediction from specific treatments.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Prognostic Information Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on the test providing prognostic information.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Patient Request Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on patient requests/inquiries about the tests.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Outcome Availability Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on speed of receiving test results quickly.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Clinical Care Information Affected Integer::3 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 3 point Likert scale response regarding whether there was any impact on decision to request molecular tumor profiling tests based on test results including information about interpretation and application to clinical care.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Cancer Diagnosis Importance Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the importance of molecular profiling of tumors in current practice for the diagnosis of cancer.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Cancer Prognosis Importance Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the importance of molecular profiling of tumors in current practice for the prognosis of cancer.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Test Cancer Treatment Importance Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the importance of molecular profiling of tumors in current practice for the treatment of cancer.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Comfort Biopsy Request Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients and the ease of requesting a fresh biopsy sample from the patient.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Benefits Explanation Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the ability to explain the benefits of this type of treatment to the patient.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Risk Explanation Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the ability to explain the risks of this type of treatment to the patient.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Time Requirement Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the acceptable amount of time required for molecular profiling.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Algorithm Comfort Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the level of comfort with the treatment algorithm used  based on the patient's tumor profile.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Plan Adherence Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the adherence to the advised treatment plan created as a result of the algorithm.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Procedure Confidence Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the confidence in the use of treatment based tumor molecular profiling.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Outcome Improvement Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the belief that using molecular profiling to guide treatment will improve patient outcomes.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Molecular Neoplasm Profile Therapy Toxicity Reduced Agreement Integer::5 Point Likert Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: The 5 point Likert scale response regarding the agreement to molecularly-tailored treatment for patients based on the belief that tumor molecular profiling will decrease treatment toxicity.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Breast Carcinoma Disease Response Current Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text descriptor of the state of breast carcinoma in an individual.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Digital Photography Complete Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether digitized photographic images were captured.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Digital Photography Not Done Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text to describe why digitized photographic images were not captured for a patient.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Digital Photography Complete Date
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Calendar date on which digitized photographic images were captured.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Breast Cup Size Measurement
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Single or multiple letters referring to the size and volume of a breast, usually in reference to sizing a brassiere or undergarment.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Breast Examination Associated Finding Result
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe a finding from a clinical examination of an individual's breast.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Breast Examination Associated Other Finding Text
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text to describe additional or different clinical breast examination findings different from those already specified.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Breast Examination Breast Laterality Name
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text name to identify which of an individual's breast was examined.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Person Past Week Reduced Feminine Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of feeling less feminine as a result of disease and treatment.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Few Weeks Difficult To Look At Self Naked EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's reported difficulty looking at themselves naked.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center clinical trial. dmr 3.12.2015

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Week Arm Shoulder Pain Score Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of any pain in the arm or shoulder.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Week Swelling Arm Hand Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of any swelling in the hand or arm.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Week Lift Move Arm Difficulty Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of difficulty raising or moving an arm sideways.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Week Ipsilateral Breast Pain Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of any pain in the affected breast.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Week Ipsilateral Breast Swelling Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of any swelling in the affected breast.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Week Ipsilateral Breast Increased Sensitivity Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of oversensitivity in the affected breast.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Body Image Scale Past Week Ipsilateral Breast Skin Problem Occurrence EORTC Quality of Life Scale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a person's report of skin problems on or in the area of the affected breast.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Treated to Untreated Breast Comparison Category
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Result of a comparison of a treated breast to the untreated contralateral breast for treatment related changes.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Georgetown University Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Breast Cancer Surgery Margin Status
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the pathologic findings of a patient's margins following a breast carcinoma surgical procedure.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Tissue Change Treatment Effect Yes No Indicator

DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center pilot study of Preoperative Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy for Resectable Pancreatic Cancer

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: FACIT-D Questionnaire Additional Concerns Diarrhea Subscale Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Numeric value representing a calculated score using the eleven Likert scales scores included in the FACIT-D Additional Concerns section.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: FACIT-D Questionnaire Trial Outcome Index Score
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Calculated numeric value using the scores from the FACT-G Physical and Functional Well-being subscale and the FACIT-D Diarrhea subscale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Treatment Based on Tumor Molecular Profile Extends Survival Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that treatment based on molecular profile, extends survival, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Treatment Based on Tumor Molecular Profile Improves Symptoms Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that treatment based on molecular profile, improves symptoms (e.g., reduces pain, increases appetite), based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Treatment Based on Tumor Molecular Profile Avoids Side Effects from Treatment Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that treatment based on molecular profile, avoids side effects from treatment, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Treatment Based on Tumor Molecular Profile Improves Quality of Life Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that treatment based on molecular profile, improves quality of life, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Standard Treatment Extends Survival Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that standard treatment extends survival, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Standard Treatment Improves Symptoms Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that standard treatment improves symptoms (e.g., reduces pain, increases appetite), based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Standard Treatment Avoids Side Effects from Treatment Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that standard treatment avoids side effects from treatment, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire How Important Standard Treatment Improves Quality of Life Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important it is that standard treatment improves quality of life, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Overall Value Treatment Based on Tumor Molecular Profile Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how important that the overall value of a treatment is based on your own tumor's molecular profile, based on a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Preference for Decision About Choosing a Treatment Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of their preference for the way to decide about choosing a treatment, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire You and Your Doctor's Cancer Treatment Decision Score 5 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of the method that their doctor and they decided about their cancer treatment, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Conflicting Expert Opinions About a Medical Test or Treatment Would Lower My Trust in the Experts Score 4 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of their agreement  that conflicting expert opinions about a medical test or treatment would lower their trust in the experts, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Would Not Have Confidence in a Medical Test or Treatment if Experts Had Conflicting Opinions Score  4 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of their agreement that they would have a lack of confidence in a medical test or treatment if experts had conflicting opinions about it, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Conflicting Expert Opinions About a Medical Test or Treatment Would Make Me Upset Score  4 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of their agreement that conflicting expert opinions about a medical test or treatment would make them upset, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Not Afraid of Trying a Medical Test or Treatment Even If Experts Had Conflicting Opinions Score  4 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of their agreement that they would not be afraid of trying a medical test or treatment even if experts had conflicting opinions about it, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Willing to Try Medical Test or Treatment if Experts Had Conflicting Opinions Score  4 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of their agreement that if experts had conflicting opinions about a medical test or treatment, they would still be willing to try it, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Attitudes and Preferences Questionnaire Would Avoid Making Decisions About A Medical Test or Treatment if Experts Had Conflicting Opinions Score  4 Point Scale
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of their agreement that they would avoid making a decision about a medical test or treatment if experts had conflicting opinions about it, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure ERBB2 Gene Positive Finding Immunohistochemistry Staining Method Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Result Yes No Indicator
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether the result of HER2 testing was confirmed to be positive through immunohistochemistry staining (IHC) and/or fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) methods.
DataElementQueryResults.changeNote: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center (LCC) clinical trial.9.26.2016.dmr

DataElementQueryResults.preferredName: Biospecimen Shipping Condition Type
DataElementQueryResults.preferredDefinition: Text descriptor of the shipping environment of a biospecimen.
